Package fr.univavignon.pokedex.api

Class PokemonFactory

java.lang.Object
fr.univavignon.pokedex.api.PokemonFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPokemonFactory
public class PokemonFactory extends Object implements IPokemonFactory
Factory class for creating instances of Pokemon. This class implements the IPokemonFactory interface. It provides a method to create Pokemon instances with specified attributes. Usage example: 

 IPokemonFactory pokemonFactory = new PokemonFactory();
 Pokemon pokemon = pokemonFactory.createPokemon(index, cp, hp, dust, candy);

This implementation provides a default constructor for creating instances of PokemonFactory.

Note: The default constructor does not perform any additional initialization or logic.

[Your Name]

  • Method Details

    • createPokemon

      public Pokemon createPokemon(int index, int cp, int hp, int dust, int candy) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Creates a new Pokemon instance with the specified attributes.
      Specified by:
      createPokemon in interface IPokemonFactory
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the Pokemon.
      cp - the combat power (CP) of the Pokemon.
      hp - the hit points (HP) of the Pokemon.
      dust - the stardust cost of the Pokemon.
      candy - the candy cost of the Pokemon.
      Returns:
      a new instance of Pokemon with the specified attributes.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of the valid range.
